website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight, collapsible kayak carrier with everything included.
pros: J style carrier comes with a built-in boarding ramp
Fold-down technology provides extra overhead clearance when not in use
cons: Works best with round crossbars, so it can't fit on all cars

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I had a set I bought several years ago and they worked well. Over time they rusted and I decided to get a new pair. You could see that they changed the design. After 2 uses one failed on the highway. I contacted Malone who dragged out the return for almost a year until I finally contacted Amazon who allowed me to return them. Malone never even asked me to return the cradles to them to inspect. I suspect that they know there is a manufacturing flaw in the new design. As I said, I used the first set for years and they were great, but I'm done with Malone. Poor product, and even worse customer service.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaF

customer_reviews.title: Better than higher price options
customer_reviews.text: I have the Malone cross bars with the j rack. Great design... The flat edge makes for easy slide in of kayak.. the available slots and guides makes for simple & secure & quick strapdown. The supplied straps are heavy-duty and durable... I bought a second set of racks and use on both RAV4 & Murano.. June 2018 update: still love these racks. Still easy to throw the kayak up onto the slide Edge and slip it into the holders. Have used with the Malone cross bars & racks on a RAV 2005 a RAV 2016 and a Murano 2010. All vehicles equipped with Factory rails.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and easily hauls a 12.5' kayak
customer_reviews.text: These are quiet on a Honda CRV with OEM equivalent racks. Have 2 sets and haul 2 12.5' kayaks at 65mph with complete stability. The fold down option is great. Make sure you check the "used" selection. Got them for ~1/2 price and they arrived essentially new in the box . Very happy with these and will keep checking for more.
customer_reviews.author: frozebubba

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this product because it would not work correctly on my aero crossbar system. They are durable and a quality product... if you have the correct square crossbars. Overall, if you have aero crossbars... dont waste your time If you have a kayak that is 10'7"+ or 60+ don't waste your time If your using it for normal 10' yaks and have the square crossbars. I would recommend these j hooks all day at that price point.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2018 Subaru Outback Factory Bars
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed product with thoughtful features. However, does not fit 2018 Subaru Outback Factory Bars liked advertised. Like others have noted, the plastic mount can be modified with power tools, or some other method, but I am not rigging a rack for the vehicle I just spent 40K on. Malone...I'd imagine Subbie drivers are a large part of your target market...design an adapter ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soilid carriers.
customer_reviews.text: Love these racks. Can get into most garages with my Grand Cherokee with these folded down. Glad I didn't get the non folding ones. Easy install. Wind noise is minimal. Don't forget to twist the straps . If you don't ,you will get an intolerable harmonic resonance that will drive you crazy after a very short time. I thought a tooth filling would come out with the vibration. . Much better price and just as solid as my friends expensive "status brand" carriers. (Thule).
customer_reviews.author: John Vieau

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for four years and love them. They’re solid, easy to fold down in 90 degree weather or 20 degrees, and the customer service is outstanding. One of the lock tabs popped out last week, and Malone is sending me four replacements—free and after four years! Customer service doesn’t get any better than that.
customer_reviews.author: C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I might like them better than my kayak!
customer_reviews.text: I installed these in the dark, with a large number of mosquitoes nipping at me. I read the instructions inside before I went out, though. VERY easy instructions and installation. Would be easier on a car, instead of a minivan. They did fit tightly, without wiggle room, on the cross bars. All of the parts seem sturdy and well thought out. I LOVE, LOVE how tight the kayak fits on them. The loops and holes for the strap are awesome. I admit, I did not use their straps, which look nice enough. But I had some very nice Thule straps that have the little "mitten" for the cleat.
customer_reviews.author: Beachnicks

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: Just took my 16ft Kayak on an 800 mile journey through rain and wind and these holders were absolutely rock steady. Super well-built and sturdy. The bow/stern lines are fantastic and the one-stop shopping is much appreciated. TWO THINGS: 1) On a longer trip (more than just around town) I highly encourage you to use the bow and stern lines provided. It also voids the warrantee if you don't use them for a trip. 2) Make sure you check and tighten up the wing nuts on your first stop after hauling your kayak as mine needed an extra quarter turn after its initial carry on my first trip.
customer_reviews.author: Todd S

customer_reviews.title: Much cheaper than a trailer
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of these to transport two 9-foot sit-on-top kayaks atop our SUV. No matter how tight you turn the hard-to-reach thumb screws, the brackets will slip back and forth on your side rails. Worse, the red straps are a major hassle. You're supposed to feed them through an open guide at the top of each J-bracket but they pop right out as soon as you throw your boats up there and then you can't slide them to the proper lengths because they get bound up. So getting two kayaks up there after a long day on the river is a struggle—especially if you lack upper-body strength and aren't 7 feet tall.
customer_reviews.author: Scenario

customer_reviews.title: Great rack makes loading much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use on top of my SUV and love them! The “slide” on them makes it possible for me to load them on the roof by myself (5’5” female). I had previously tried both the Yakima J-hook and the Malone Stax Pro 2, neither one of which I could easily load by myself. I traveled over 600 miles in one day and had no need to tighten or adjust them; they seemed very secure. The fold-down option is great, too, as I don’t have to remove them to park in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Denise R LaDue

customer_reviews.title: Works ok my Jeep!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2008 Jeep Grand Cherokee and I have the pen factory roof racks and crossings, these mounts fit ok. They are not as secure due to the shape of my crossings, they would be much better on the steel square crossings. Overall they works good, and the fact that they fold down, I don’t have to worry about hitting them off of something
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Voege

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best kayak J-rack; worth the higher price.
customer_reviews.text: You do get what you pay for. While these kayak racks are more expensive than other J-racks, they're much better made, a combination of metal framing, high impact and resilient plastic load surface, and cloth covers over foam around the verticals. Folding and unfolding is very sure, and when folded down they are not at all unattractive. But what really sets these apart is that they work with the Malone kayak loader, which will hang from the slots at the outside edge; the kayak loader makes it easy for two people to hoist and remove a kayak, and makes it quite possible for one person to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish they fit my crossbars better.
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, these are the best J style racks on the market. I wish they had a lock and fit my crossbars better. I have a Tahoe and the wide oval factory bars are definitely not for these racks. Don't get me wrong, they do stay on at a bit of an angle, but they are built for square bars. I wish there was an adapter for oval bars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great service, well made racks
customer_reviews.text: Great racks, timely delivery. Had a question about the product, and the company answered quickly. Purchased longer screws from Fastenal, as the ones in the box were too short for our crossbar, but no big deal, easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: LoRye

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, fits on the car
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these mounted on top of my 2016 subaru outback. They work well and hold two kayaks securely on the roof. They were easy to attach to the roof rack that comes build into the car. The shape of the plastic that is in contact with the roof rack doesn't match particularly well to the roof rack cross bars well, but it hasn't been a problem for keeping the kayaks on the roof.
customer_reviews.author: KateTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: The bottom is hard plastic which is what sits against your rails. My rails are steel so I had to wedge something soft between them. Also, this was supposed to fit any rail. Like everyone else is saying it needed longer bolts. I picked those up at the hardware store. I bought these because they fold down when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Van Tuyl

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased a cheaper carrier for my kayaks. I have a tall truck and am short so when I saw these have the loader assist I decided to try them. I love them!!! I have not used the loader yet since my 6'4" husband can put them up, but these are much easier to use than the other carrier. A simple push and pull of a button and yr ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: joanna mullen

customer_reviews.title: strong, safe and a great value
customer_reviews.text: these racks, with their rectangular cut outs below, hold very steady on thule square bars. the metal [not plastic!] rigid strap that holds the rack onto the crossbar also gives me a strong sense of security. and the built in ramp on each rack helps loading on a tall vehicle. i bought the loading tool that would allow an individual to easily raise or lower a kayak, but since i've always had a companion when i've used the racks, we just muscled the boats up and down. still, the availability of that loader, much simpler and much cheaper than the loaders available from other manufacturers, is a real plus.
customer_reviews.author: J. Klugman

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit Nissan Rogue factory rails.  Great produce otherwuse.
customer_reviews.text: This will not fit on Nissan Rogue factory roof racks. My racks are angled so unfortunately, I cannot use this. I will have to get another cross bar rack to use with this. Easy to install and use. Easy to tie down. Very durably made. Definitely staying within this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy F

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit rhino rack aero with provided hardware
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The only issues I've had is that they do not fit onto Rhino Rack Aero bars with the provided hex bolts. When I contacted customer service about this, I was assured that the product would fit the profile of my bars and that if the bolts weren't long enough I could purchase longer bolts through the Malone online store ($5 for bolts and $5 more for shipping). I'm a bit disappointed to get them and not be able to use them until longer bolts arrive, but I guess I caught the downside of "fits MOST".
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Makes loading kayaks easy for one person
customer_reviews.text: I have two pair of these for two 40 pound 12 foot kayaks. The ramp on the front makes it easy to wrest the boat on before you push it up into place. High quality materials. The only thing I did not like is that the metal bracket that fits under your crossbar comes only in one shape/configuration. I have an Outback with oblong bars, and the brackets do not have much contact. They should offer a few different shapes of brackets to have an even better fit. I think because of this bracket not fitting the shape of the crossbar, I have to tighten the wingnuts more often. But overall a great product that I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Larry

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommended!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these. The ease in attaching them is unbelievable. If I can do it, so can you. The way the straps are explained in the instructions, leave no doubt that this is a superior product. No worry about the kayak going anywhere with this exceptional product. The Malone company themselves were awesome!! I was unsure of which ones to get. They explained the difference and asked questions of my use before giving me their opinion. And they were honest. It wasn't always the most expensive item but the best for what I needed it for!!! Nice company! Nice product!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great carriers - fittings could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted folding carriers so that I would be able to park in the garage without having to remove them every time. These work perfectly. The only downside is the fitting mechanism - it is a little fiddly and you really need to lay a cloth on the car roof for when you inevitably drop the bolts or the washers or the fixing plate itself. I was hoping for this to better designed.
customer_reviews.author: JTeezy

customer_reviews.title: Needs a way to lock them on
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but worth it. If there would some way to lock it onto the crossbars I would give it 5 stars. Keep in mind you'll be leaving this untended (sometimes for days) at some remote lake or river and sticky fingers will find it hard to resist. On the plus side it goes on and off so easily I can just take them off (but my wife can't reach and she has to leave them on)!
customer_reviews.author: Leaner

customer_reviews.title: Quality kayak rack at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a year now and just bought a second pair for my wife's new kayak. They are sturdy and easy to use. My kayak has been very secure when using these. I have only driven up to 55 miles per hour with the kayak on the car, but I had no problems at that speed. Folding them down allows me to leave them on and still get in my garage. I also give 5 stars for Malone customer service. Once of the pads on the base of the rack came off. I emailed Malone and they send new ones right out.
customer_reviews.author: 97wrangler

customer_reviews.title: Best kayak racks out there
customer_reviews.text: Best kayak racks out there. Bad ass company. One thing, if you have Yakima racks, or the round bar style rack systems it is extremely hard to keep these from pivoting. I thought it was an issue at first, kinda irritating having to go back and straighten them after unloading or loading. But I found out, that it actually makes it loading and unloading easier when they pivot! True story bro! Anyways, LOVE my Malone racks!!! Wish they made a cross bar system!!!
customer_reviews.author: iZombiei

customer_reviews.title: Nice but mounting brackets need improvement
customer_reviews.text: Nice racks. Easy to assemble & install. Universal mounting brackets need some improvement. Once installed on my manufacturers cross bars, j hooks did not feel stable. Purchased with Telos loader and both were returned as unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia andress

customer_reviews.title: Kayak Carrier ROCKS!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this kayak carrier. The one I had previously were just two posts sticking up. Yeah, you could, in theory, fit 4 kayaks on it, but what a pain, even for one! This is easy, fits well on my Yakima bars, and my kayak rides fantastic on it. No fear of wind or anything affecting the boat, it is very secure in this J-style rack. I have had the sun fade the cushioning around the bars, but it is only cosmetic. I also remove it from my car often and this rack is very easy to take on or off if needed, or to place on your paddling partner's car.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Buckner

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack but needs longer bolts.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for our kayaks. They are well engineered and very well made. The ramp feature makes it easy to load the kayak. The hardware pack includes two length bolts to mount to the roof rack; 60mm and 70mm. I am mounting these on the factory Audi Q5 cross bar and the longer 70mm bolts are barely long enough to catch about 3 threads with the nuts and that is without using the provided washers. This can easily be resolved by purchasing and installing 80mm bolts. If proper length bolts had been included, this would have been a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: MCom

customer_reviews.title: Th Best Kayak rack we have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I travel by auto a lot, and most of the time it's a road trip with our Bikes and kayaks aboard. We bought a new 4Runner and decided to try these racks. They fit our rig perfectly and made loading kayaks for us 60 year olds a snap. . We traveld nearly 2500 miles with these things on the roof and found no noticeable Rack whistle while loaded or unloaded. The boats stayed secure the whole trip. The product was delivered when promised , was easy to install, and looks like park of our 4Runner when closed down. This is the rack you want.
customer_reviews.author: William Lander

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit well on factory aero style cross bars.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning these for another brand. I have factory aero style cross bars and these really did not attach very well. If you are mounting to standard square cross bars, I think they would work very well. They also do not have the ability to lock to my crossbars. I bought these before I got my kayak, so I didn't get a chance to try mounting the kayak before I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even better company
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product and company. I bough two pairs of these for my Jeep Wrangler and they fit perfectly and were very easy to load and unload. After a couple of uses one of the locking tabs on one of the units broke. The tab didn't stop me from using the unit however I still wanted to fix it. I emailed the company and within 5 days I already received my new tab. They were very helpful and extremely quick to respond. I would definitely do business with this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Ball

customer_reviews.title: Secure.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. We got the Malone Telos loaders to go with these. They make it very easy for just one person to load kayaks. These cradles hold very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one set first to make sure it would fit my vehicle before ordering a second. It was very easy to install and fit my factory bars tightly. I especially liked having the two different bolt lengths to choose from. At the same time as I ordered this I also ordered the Malone Telos Lift Assist and it operates very smoothly with the carrier. I foresee getting a lot of use out of this this summer because now I won't have to get people to help me lift kayaks up onto the roof of my vehicle. I ordered my second set of carriers this morning!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Hill

customer_reviews.title: A+ Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great product. Easy to use, easy to install. Because of the product's lifetime warranty, Aaron at Malone technical support resolved immediately (and for free!) three issues: first, he sent me new brackets to better fit my 2013 Ford Escape. Second, he replaced a release pin that broke. He also sent me a replacement pad for the base when I lost it. There's something to be said for a company with such great customer service to support their great product. I bought two sets of these and used them all summer for my two kayaks... Dynamite.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Broke after only using a few times
customer_reviews.text: They were great for one or two times and then the buttons you pop up and down to lock them in place started to get really stiff and after only using maybe 5 times, one of the buttoms completely broke. After only using for half a summer it was very disappointing. Haven't contacted the manufacturer yet to see about their warranty, but plan to.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole H

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 10' long 36" wide fishing kayak. They arrived well packaged and fully assembled. It took a few minutes to attach to my Yakima round bars. They really grip the bars well. I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Segura

customer_reviews.title: Performs good, looks better :).
customer_reviews.text: The rack works fine, and aesthetically it has a "cool" factor built in ;). I like the skid plate feature, it helps with heavier kayaks. The only remark I have, and wanted to give it a 4-star rating, is that I believe the padding could've been better/thicker to distribute point-loads slightly better. I add some closed cell foam when I load my kayaks.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: works great, fits great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go on our Jeep that has a Barricade tube rack from Extreme Terrain that has 2" round tubing....works great, fits great. We were very impressed and it was better than we expected. Ready to go Kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my SX4!
customer_reviews.text: I use these mounts on the OEM roof rack of my Suzuki SX4. The mounts are easy to use and very stable! I had no issues strapping them on my car and then putting them to use. Using these racks for my Sea Kayak, I can also have room for my SUP to be mounted on the other side of the car for when my husband and I go out together!
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Trboyevich

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: The fold down feature is great. I bought a second set.
customer_reviews.author: D Olson

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well with wide kayaks
customer_reviews.text: Had to widen attachment points to my factory cross bars. My Malibu tandem kayak was too upright and kept tipping over on the trails.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan ma

customer_reviews.title: Very nice carry system
customer_reviews.text: Very nice carry system. Built very well and the folding capability is handy. Only complaint would be that fabric gets sun bleached quickly. A UV stabilized material would look better.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary S.

customer_reviews.title: Love the design, love the look, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought together with the Malone Auto Rack. Decided on Malone based on what I thought was a better mounting system then Thule's. The roof rack and the J-bars were easy to install. As a plus the J-bars are very easy to take off and put back on. This is a huge plus as I don't like to drive around with them on top of my car when not using with my kayaks. Love the design, love the look, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Maceddox

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Toyota Sequoia and was a bit nervous that the racks would not anchor well to my factory installed roof rack. The racks attached easily and seem to be holding on well. The kayaks, once mounted and tied down, held firm for a long (2-hr) trip into the mountains with lots of turns and bumps. Having them fold down later was a great bonus as it allowed mw to later pull into the garage without removing the racks. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: D. Finn

customer_reviews.title: and I love my first
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set, and I totally love it. Super easy to setup and to carry the kayaks. I contacted the seller to replace a missing piece, and they were amazing and sent the replacement super fast. I totally recommend this product to everybody. Amazing product and company.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing product. I bought two for my durango. It looks amazing good.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Souza

customer_reviews.title: The fold ability is great. If you have large yaks
customer_reviews.text: The fold ability is great. If you have large yaks, like fishing yaks, this is not for you. They are hard to fit with the angle back leaning position. They touch each other unless set at max distance apart. Wish I had bought just and extra wide cross bar. They are easy to take off but takes a little time to put back on. On a RAV 4 with flat bars.
customer_reviews.author: David Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Extremely stable on stock Ford Escape rack!
customer_reviews.text: Just had a chance to use these for the first time and they performed great! I have 2 sets that I use on a stock 2007 Ford Escape rack and each kayak weighed 50 lbs. maxing the rack out at 100 lbs. I drove about 65 MPH all the way there an back (2.5 hour round trip) and they didn't budge! I also needed different mounting plates for my vehicle type and I contacted Malone and they shipped me 2 sets the next day free of charge! Great company and great product! Buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: versatile and simple kayak rack
customer_reviews.text: The Malone kayak racks that fold down have been great. Following the instructions for mounting your kayak, the kayak is extremely snug and does not budge. WIth a small step stool you can get the kayak up into the rack. It is best to have 2 people to do that, depending on the size and weight of the kayak. They fold down easily so we can get into our garage. They were very easy to install onto our existing roof rack bars. The hardware is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Charles K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my kayak
customer_reviews.text: Installed this kayak rack on my own with ease. This past weekend, I hauled my kayak up to Rainbow Springs with no problems. I'm very happy with the holder and would indeed recommend to others. Happy kayaking :)
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I got them to use with my Malone Telos Kayak Load Assist Module for Malone AutoLoader XV Kayak Carrier, so that I could load my two kayaks onto my Escape by myself. This system works much better than I thought it would. I'm 61 years old, 5'3" tall, and got my two kayaks loaded onto my vehicle all by myself this afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: very good option for carrying my kayak
customer_reviews.text: I had a bit of a hard time figuring out the instruction for mounting these on my car. But, once I got them in place, they work really well. I especially like the face that they fold down, so they are not sticking up every day. That way, I can keep them on the car and not need to take them off each time after use.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to install, fold and use. Like the low profile
customer_reviews.author: wendi

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality carriers. Used them with two 11 ft kayaks and no issues. I needed longer bolts to mount on my TracRac system. Contacted Malone and their customer service was very helpful and sent me the longer bolts without issue. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: OU812

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and ready
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy kayak carriers. Easy to install on the car. I was lucky they fit one of my two roof racks without any modifications which some people mentioned in their reviews when they installed their racks. It would be nice if universal rack makers would include multiple types of bottoms that slid or bolted on where the carrier fits to the roof rack, since some roof racks are oval, some round, or even square. These are heavier than I had expected and do wish that they were a little lighter. Fold down feature is excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: Flyingslanted

customer_reviews.title: Great way to secure your kayak
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mount and holds my kayak securely. I like the straps that came with it but not the rope tie downs for the front and back. I use my other straps for that.
customer_reviews.author: wrgagirl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for your kayaks.  Leave them on all summer and park in your garage
customer_reviews.text: Pure genius... these. Half the price of THULE and great technology. We bought two Werner step stools and bloop your kayaks are on, they're off, cinch them down...5 minutes tops. Sturdy buggers hold your boats at speeds over the limit. Very little noise, too.
customer_reviews.author: Muleshoe Texas

customer_reviews.title: Will hold a kayak!!!
customer_reviews.text: These kayak carriers perform as advertised: they will hold a kayak on the roof of your car, and when not in use, they fold down. Easy to install. They do hum a bit at speed, but you about have to expect that. You could remove them when not going to be in use for a few days, but the roof bars hum, too, and really, it's easier just to crank up the stereo. Another plus is that there is really no way to ruin the aerodynamics of a Subaru Forester...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to flip up/flip up the racks
customer_reviews.text: Had this rack for a while now...though the material faded, it still works well with hauling a kayak. Very easy to flip up/flip down the racks. Fully functional after several years.
customer_reviews.author: Kalin Ayhan

customer_reviews.title: but I believe I made I made a best decision. The arms and the holders are very ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with carrying kayaks and buying kayak rood carriers, but I believe I made the best decision. The arms and the holders are very firm and sturdy, and the best feature is that they fold down so I don't need to remove them when entering low ceiling garage/parking. The price is reasonable comparing with other products. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Reza R

customer_reviews.title: Locking mech broke first time used
customer_reviews.text: First time we used it was yesterday and one of the locking mechanisms on the j-bar broke. Very disappointed since our return window ended just a week ago and I don’t know how to contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: cheapmama

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing, good materials
customer_reviews.text: Engineering well done!!! I searched long and hard for a J-Carrier that's flexible enough to not only use on standard cross bars but also on pick up truck bed racks, which are wider than your regular cross bars. This product is amazing, good materials, through and through. They have even thought through the tie down process. Very pleased,
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Monteagudo

customer_reviews.title: Great product !
customer_reviews.text: This kayak carrier is excellent. It's easy to put on and take off. I used it for one kayak and tied another kayak on the side of it on top of my vehicle. Get the folding model. The extra $5 was worth it. Very solid. The design is great especially that you can lay your kayak up against it and with a push it will slide into the groove. Will probably purchase another for the other side.
customer_reviews.author: 4solar2

customer_reviews.title: Already had one set, added this to carry two ...
customer_reviews.text: Already had one set, added this to carry two kayaks. They work very well. Just brought two kayaks 200 miles at interstate speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Great J-Style carrier
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and the came in 2 days with regualr shipping. They mount fairly easy and secured my kayak on a 1800 mile trip. They fold easily and don not have wind noise. The Kyak stayed secure at 70-75 mph. The wind resistance did not cut my mpg as I thought. The only draw is that it catches some wind turbulance and vibration when following trucks.
customer_reviews.author: FB

customer_reviews.title: we have used these on three different style roof racks ...
customer_reviews.text: we have used these on three different style roof racks and have had zero issues with them securing. they hold our Dagger stratos 14.5 kayaks well at interstate speeds as well as on uneven bumpy trails leading to secluded boat ramps.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Good Rack, Be sure to secure it.
customer_reviews.text: If I had the cash I'd get the easy to use Thule but even this system seems pricey since I only paid $300 for my kayak. Still, once installed it stays put and I bought the bike lock with chain to fend off thieves. It's not that easy to get the nuts on the screws so you don't want to do it all the time. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Patty G. McKee

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This product is worth every penny and I absolutely love it the only thing I would say is you have to do a lot of adjustment if your luggage rack has any kind of curvature in it as the base seems to require flat luggage rack panels.
customer_reviews.author: trainman 305

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for transporting kayaks easily
customer_reviews.text: We are so pleased with this purchase! Initially, we had purchased the non-folding J-Style Car Rack kayak carriers. Unfortunately, we could not get in and out of our garage. So, for a few dollars more, we opted for the folding variety. Installation was incredibly easy. We have had no difficulties in securing our kayaks on multiple trips. I would highly recommend this to anyone in need of transporting their kayaks without much fuss or muss!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Todd

customer_reviews.title: very very good
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised. This makes loading my large kayak (36" WIDE) safe and easy on the car. The load-assist ramps really do make the difference. Plus these are easy-on, easy-off. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: EJTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Good but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Great if you need collapsable J-hooks so you can clear your garage like I needed. The price is extremely high compared to those that do not fold but the quality seems good. Held my 12' Sun Dolphin Bali on a 2.5 hour trip just fine at highway speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Fugate

customer_reviews.title: These are the best money I've spent yet on Kayak gear
customer_reviews.text: These are the best money I've spent yet on Kayak gear. They look awesome and I love the folding mechanism. Best of all I found out after buying these that Malone makes a Telos EZ lift system designed to go with these J hooks. Win Win
customer_reviews.author: Sledwrecker

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I watched a YouTube video on the kayak J-Rack and liked what I saw. It was very easy to install. Took less than 10 minutes, by myself. Didn't care for the tie-downs that were included and purchased a sturdier pair from Bi-Mart. No complaints about this J Rack. I can easily recommend the Malone!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Kayak Carrier!
customer_reviews.text: We have used these carriers to haul kayaks between Iowa and the Florida Keys without a problem. Being able to fold the carriers flat when not in use is convenient and improves gas mileage and wind noise. We have added the "loader" which makes it easy for 1 person to safely load a kayak onto a SUV.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lamport

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Came scratched as other people noted from shipping. It feels sturdy. My kayak felt safe without the bow/stern lines attached. Pretty quiet on my roof rack and its nice that it folds down. I have the $20 one from amazon as well, but haven't set it up yet.. it is my backup in case I need 2 kayaks on my car.
customer_reviews.author: D. Francey

customer_reviews.title: Get Yaking!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and nice for those who arent teriribly strong when it comes ot lifiting the kayak onto the rack. Not exactly thrilled with the fit on my cross bars. Sturdy well built product, but a little on the pricey side. Love the fact they fold and seem to be holding up to the weather rather well. Would have given 5 stars, but the price was a factor for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sheaffertj

customer_reviews.title: love these
customer_reviews.text: love these, good price, easy to install, very stable. Love the strap holder (not shown on picture) on top to hold straps in place when loading kayak.
customer_reviews.author: candy

customer_reviews.title: HOPEFULLY MODIFICATIONS TO CLAMP COMING SOON
customer_reviews.text: i feel it is pretty simple to use as long as you have the strength to get it up there.. the only negative comment i have is on the installation... if the rep that i spoke to is correct, there will be a modification on wedges for the clamp to accomadate a ford escape luggage rack.. presently, you have a difficult time leveling the car racks with out sticking popsicle sticks or something to level the kayak carrier.
customer_reviews.author: pete

customer_reviews.title: Parts Missing
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of Malone Downloader J-Style carriers. The first set I bought from another source and paid around $140, these were around $100, only problem was that they came in a plain box with no mounting hardware or any of the straps and bow lines. Luckily I contacted Malone customer service and they were very helpful in supplying the missing parts for free, no questions asked. So I rate the carriers 5 stars and Amazon 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: tstein

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems very nice
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift. Don’t know if my son has attached it yet or not
customer_reviews.author: CAT

customer_reviews.title: Well made product and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and easy to install. Routing and Securing the strap over the raised bar even if you are tall is a bit of a challenge so if you are short or have a large high vehicle get a short ladder. The ramps make pushing the Kayak up into place easy and once the top strap is in position, the lower portion of the strap installs easily and securely.
customer_reviews.author: Down in Delaware

customer_reviews.title: The Best?
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Having used both Thule and Yakima racks for our kayaks, I find the Malones are superior. Work great with the Malone loading assists.
customer_reviews.author: gjportland

customer_reviews.title: Fold down feature and the strapping feature is great versus standard carriers where you have to tie down ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Fold down feature and the strapping feature is great versus standard carriers where you have to tie down the kayak with loops etc. For the next feature, try to work in a way to easily get the straps back over the kayak once you've loaded the kayak in order to tighten it down. If you can do that then you get that 5th star! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Installs easily, sturdy, makes for loading a kayak by myself very easy, secures kayak well because of the way the strap goes through the base--I do not need to use bow and stern lines, I just use the straps that come with it. It fits on my Rhino Rack oval shaped cross bars. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great Racks !
customer_reviews.text: Bought these racks sight unseen based on several reviews I read on line. I am so glad I purchased these over the other racks I was considering. The materials and construction is far superior to the others I looked at and the fit on my Thule crossbars is perfect. Folded down there is no wind noise. If your thinking about racks for your kayak, look at these, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Whatsgnu

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use - convenient to leave them on my vehicle and they work great with the Malone Telos system. I had a question about attaching these to the crossbars of the roof rack on my 2003 Ford Explorer and Malone's customer service was excellent. I highly recommend the product and Malone
customer_reviews.author: M. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Extremely impressed with the quality and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of comparisons and reviews, I purchased two of these racks to attach two fourteen foot kayaks to an Accord. Using Thule crossbars,these were simple to install and feel very secure. After tossing the kayaks in once and learning the system, the entire process now only takes 2-3 minutes to attach each boat.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schmoe

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described. I am 5ft. tall and 50+ and with the help of a step stool, I can load and unload my kayak alone. I like how easy product is to attach and remove from car.
customer_reviews.author: Sal B

customer_reviews.title: Hands down my new favorite
customer_reviews.text: Having the Malone Downloaders has been awesome! Our garage height limited us from most other J racks but these were perfect! Just lay them flat and pull right in! Solid construction, stylish, and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Durable. Took a beating and still works awesome. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: C12345

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak mount
customer_reviews.text: We just hauled our kayak from NJ to SC and the mount worked well. Easy to use. I supplemented it with a cable and lock wrapped around the seat and roof rack to thwart any kayak thieves. Very happy with this carrier. I cannot imagine that a Thule would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: ChazM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They collapse to a low profile when not in active use and are quite rigid when used .
customer_reviews.author: Phred

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it installed. Super easy to install. Have not put my kayak on it yet but it is much sturdier than the Reese J-rack that broke on my first use. I also bought their loader and it looks like getting my craft on and off my Pilot will be much easier.
customer_reviews.author: ryan hankins

customer_reviews.title: Would have given it 5 stars but I thought they should have reinforced the hole from which the ratchet lifts used with it will ha
customer_reviews.text: Very solid well-designed product. Would have given it 5 stars but I thought they should have reinforced the hole from which the ratchet lifts used with it will hang (but I reinforced these myself and otherwise absolutely love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in NC

customer_reviews.title: nice rack
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and load, instructions are very clear, hardwear and straps are included. Travels well. As someone new to kayaking I have nothing prior to compare it to. I read reviews and this seemed like the best choice for me. I have a 2004 Outback w/factory installed rack- it works fine. If I had to change something it would be to add some kind of notch to help keep the straps centered and from falling down when loading the kayaks into cradles. Fair price for the product, extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: jweb

customer_reviews.title: Simply worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these after Pa. to Florida and back with our 4 Runner.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: They are heavy duty and very nicely built. They straps are very
customer_reviews.text: I'm brand new to the kayaking world and I just received these j-racks. They are the first pair I have every bought and I do think that I got my money's worth! They are heavy duty and very nicely built. They straps are very, very nice and look like they will hold very well. They are easy to fold up and down as well. I am so glad that I spent the extra money and purchased these racks. I can't wait to see them in action.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Great rack system, easy to use and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these at the beginning of summer when I got a new car (small SUV).... they work great, were easy to install too! I have two sets since I have two kayaks. I also got the load assist thingy to go with them, which makes loading my kayaks a breeze (especially for being 5'2 lol).
customer_reviews.author: Brooke O.

product_meta.title: Malone Downloader Folding J-Style Universal Car Rack Kayak Carrier with Bow and Stern Lines
product_meta.description: The J-DownLoader with Bow and Stern includes everything you need to carry one kayak vertically on your roof top. When not in use, the carrier folds down to create more overhead clearance. The built in loading ramps help load and unload the kayak while oversized padding helps protect the boat once strapped down. The Malone universal JAWZ mounting hardware fits round, square and factory oval cross rails.
feature_bullets: J-style kayak carrier with built-in boarding ramp for easy loading
Fold down technology increases overhead clearance. Compatible with the MPG351 Telos Load Assist
Oversized padding protects boat during transport
JAWZ mounting hardware fits round, square and most factory oval cross rails, includes both 60mm and 70mm pre-coated mounting bolts;Cam style load straps with buckle protectors

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
